paper_abstract: Multicore CPUs can be combined with GPUs to perform computations over 3D unstructured meshes on heterogeneous CPU-GPU clusters. The authors explain how to unlock the CPUs' computing power without slowing down other tasks related to data movement. By solving the representative diffusion equation using the cell-centered finite volume method, the authors demonstrate that combining the computing capacity of CPUs and GPUs delivers a performance advantage over the GPU-only approach.
paper_title: SCALABLE HETEROGENEOUS CPU-GPU COMPUTATIONS FOR UNSTRUCTURED TETRAHEDRAL MESHES
